intro: Centaurea hakkariensis, commonly known as Hakkari knapweed, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces vibrant purple or red flowers that attract pollinators. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native region.
